response:
Among the socioeconomic classes, in terms of a person who commutes to work or school, my final answer is:

Middle-class.

According to the Pew Research Center, middle-class Americans are more likely to commute to work than any other socioeconomic group. In 2019, 87% of middle-class Americans commuted to work, compared to 77% of upper-class Americans, 73% of lower-class Americans, and 67% of working-class Americans. This suggests that middle-class individuals are more likely to be involved in daily commuting, whether it be to a job or school.
